intro: Gelseminum molle, commonly known as the soft gelsemium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain the toxic seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
